title: "Porcelain dish with ""Hob in the Well"" motif" ‘Hob in the well’ dish

  physical_appearance: This is white porcelain dish painted in Kakiemon Japanese style. The border is decorated with a floral motif. In the center
 there are three figures. There is a man on the left. On the right
 there is a woman attempting to rescue a person in a huge vase. There are no chipped edges or cracks seen on the dish.

  subject_terms_1: exports representation (form of expression) flower (motif) tableware

  subject_terms_2: Exports Motifs Sima
 Guang
 1019-1086 Kakiemon porcelain Ceramic tableware

  subject_terms_3: Ceramics

  sgcool_label_text: Kakiemon porcelain from Japan was greatly admired in several European countries. The scene and design of this dish is known in Europe as the “Hob in the well”. Due to its popularity
 Chinese and European kilns copied and reproduced dishes of this type from around the 18th century.

There is a man on the left. On the right, there is a woman attempting to rescue a person in a huge vase. There are no chipped edges or cracks seen on the dish.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: Kakiemon porcelain from Japan was greatly admired in several European countries. The scene and design of this dish is known in Europe as the “Hob in the well”. Due to its popularity, Chinese and European kilns copied and reproduced dishes of this type from around the 18th century.
